citation.article-title: Polaribacter butkevichii sp. nov., a novel marine mesophilic bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae.

p.s: Description of Polaribacter butkevichii sp. nov.
Polaribacter butkevichii (but.ke'vi.chi.i. N.L butkevichii named after V. S. Butkevich, Russian marine microbiologist)
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic with respiratory metabolism, chemoorganotrophic, nonmotile, asporogenic regular rods 0.4–0.6 μM wide and 0.6- 2.0 μM long.
A gliding motility was not observed.
Oxidase, catalase, β-galactosidase, and alkaline phosphatase positive.
Colonies are circular, convex, viscous, shiny with entire edges, 1–3 mm in diameter on marine agar.
They produce yellow nondiffusible carotenoid pigments.
No growth is observed without Na+.
They grow at 1–5% NaCl and at 4–32°C, with optima of 2% and 21–23°C, respectively.
The pH range of growth was 5.8–10.0, with optimum growth occurring between 7.6 and 8.2.
Flexirubin pigments are absent.
Degrade casein, gelatin, starch, DNA, Tween 40 and Tween 80.
Do not hydrolyze agar, cellulose (CM-cellulose and filter paper), chitin, urea, and Tween 20.
Form acid from D-galactose, D-glucose, D-maltose, DL-xylose, and glycerol, but not from L-arabinose, D-lactose, D-sucrose, adonitol, dulcitol, inositol, and mannitol.
Utilize D-glucose, D-lactose, D-mannose, and mannitol as sole sources of carbon and energy.
Utilization of L-arabinose, D-sucrose, inositol, sorbitol, citrate, fumarate, and malonate is not observed.
Nitrate reduction is negative.
H2S is produced.
Indole and acetoin (Voges-Proskauer reaction) are not produced.
Susceptible to ampicillin, carbenicillin, oleandomycin, lincomycin, and tetracycline.
Resistant to kanamycin, benzylpenicillin, neomycin, streptomycin, gentamicin, and polymyxin B.
G + C content of the DNA was 32.4 mol%.
The type strain is KMM 3938T (=KCTC 12100T = CCUG 48005T).
Isolated from sea water collected in Amursky Bay, Gulf of Peter the Great, Sea of Japan, Russia.
